ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] It's been swell folks
ygData.msgSnippet: Did my own logging using filemon and sure, they are looking at those spots but I don t think Verant is to blame. IMHO it s more likely that M$ is to blame. I
ygData.messageBody:
Did my own logging using filemon and sure, they are looking at those spots but
I don't think Verant is to blame. IMHO it's more likely that M$ is to blame.

I think that those checks are made by wininet.dll when you create a new
instance
of the CInternetSession class and there is probably no way you can turn
them off
(at least none I found in my reference books)

/Boppen



At 17.46 2000-04-05 +0200, you wrote:

>I doubt anyone have c: in their everquest catalog
>
>
>"

>Eqgame Open C:\WINDOWS\HISTORY\HISTORY.IE5\INDEX.DAT SUCCESS CREATENEW
>OPENEXISTING READWRITE DENYNONE
>
>Eqgame Seek C:\WINDOWS\HISTORY\HISTORY.IE5 INDEX.DAT SUCCESS Beginning
>Offset: 0 / New offset: 0 *3 lines
>
>Eqgame Read C:\WINDOWS\HISTORY\HISTORY.IE5\INDEX.DAT SUCCESS Offset: 0
>Length: 0 **20 LINES!!!
>
>Eqgame Attributes C:\WINDOWS\TEMPORARY INTERNET FILES\CONTENT.IE5 SUCCESS

>lines
>
>Eqgame Attributes C:\WINDOWS\HISTORY\HISTORY.IE5\DESKTOP.INI SUCCESS
>GetAttributes
>
>Eqgame Seek C:\WINDOWS\TEMPORARY INTERNET FILES\CONTENT.IE5\INDEX.DAT
>SUCCESS Beginning Offset: 0 / New offset: 0 *9 lines

>then RIGHT after those
>
>Eqgame Read C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM\RASAPI32.DLL SUCCESS Offset: 131072 Length:
>4096 *2 lines
>
>Eqgame Read C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM\TAPI32.DLL SUCCESS Offset: 106496 Length:
>4096 - 2 lines

>then randomly later on I keep seeing 3 lines of this here and there:

>Eqgame Seek C:\WINDOWS\TEMPORARY INTERNET FILES\CONTENT.IE5\INDEX.DAT
>SUCCESS Beginning Offset: 0 / New offset: 0
>
>"

>"Kevin L. Crawford" wrote:
>
> > Agreed.
> >
> > They've gone too far this time.
> >
> > I sent a email complaining to bmcquaid@... (Brad),
> jbutler@...
> > (Jeff Butler) and jsmedley@... (john smedley). I suggest that
> anyone
> > who feels strongly that this will compromise EverQuest send these three a
> > courteous email regarding the matter.
> >
> > Don't flame, be polite and be concise. Hopefully we can get them to see
> > reason. I personally will not be playing again until/unless that part of
> > the eula is removed.
> >
> > It's been wonderful.... farewell my friends...
> >
> > Kev
> >
> > aka: Lyrnia Jongleur, Bard of Norrath (Retired)
> >
> > >
> > > Well, since Mr. Smedley and company have decided that to protect
> their own
> > > backside (see....lies we got away with till some smart users outfoxed us)
> > > and are putting this in their EULA....
> > >
> > > "You hereby grant us permission to download Game-related files to
> you. You
> > > also grant us permission to access, extract and upload
> > > (i) Game-related data as part of the patching process and (ii) data
> > > relating to any program that we, in our reasonable discretion, determine

> > >
> > > In case the above doesn't make a lot of sense to you - in plain
> English it
> > > means....
> > >
> > > You give us permission to look at anything WE think we need to inside
> your
> > > PC - and upload it to our offices.
> > >
> > > I don't know bout the rest of you, but I have a heck of a lot of personal
> > > information, CC #s, Tax information, etc on the same machine I use for
> > > 'gaming' - and I'll be dammed if I give them a blank check to poke around
> > > as they see fit - and ship things of interest back to their offices.
> Sorry
> > > - trust only goes so far.
